text: [Music]
one of the best things I've learned at
HBS is this concept of filling an unmet
need and that was a very very simple and
very helpful framework for me to think
about the music industry because now
when I sit in the class every case that
we have and every sort of difficulty
that the protagonist is facing in my
head I'm thinking what unmet needs are
there in the music industry and how can
I solve them or who is already serving
those unmet needs and how can I go and
work for them and add my uh value as a
har MBA is what they're trying to do I
think for me by answering that question
that's what I'll know when I do in 2015
either I'll go somewhere that I think is
addressing an unmet need in the music
industry very well or I'll go and try to
start something that I think can't
address that unmet need that nobody else
has tried to do yet growing up I felt
that music and music imagery Bea um what
artists were saying and also through
music videos had a profound impact on
how I imagined myself as a young woman
so when I would see things that were
like the Spice Girls I would actually
feel very powered when I'd see things
though that were actually not good for
women by making them seem like sex
objects or like making them uh not in
control of their own destiny I always
felt quite discouraged I didn't like
that there were not accurate uh
representations of women in the music
industry as diversely as I felt there
were for men and I think one of the
coolest Parts about the music industry
now is that there's room for new
leadership to come and innovate and I
think when you do contribute something
meaningful to a music to a to a business
space to an industry people Trust you
and I think that's when you get to to
reshape the rules a little bit and focus
on producing content that you think will
be good for the world
